result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

***CASH BOND PREVIOUSLY POSTED***
Home by 9:30 pm unless working at Taco Bell in Minocqua - and must be home within 30 minutes after a shift. Curfew from 9:30 pm to 4:00 am with the only exception being for work purposes, Not to possess, use, or ingest illegal drugs, Maintain absolute sobriety, Not to possess or consume intoxicants, No taverns or to be in the tavern portion of any restaurant premises, notify COC in writing if address changes, continue ALS drug patch. GPS monitoring will continue.

1:40 PM Defendant Dennis E Meshigaud in court appearing pro se.  Attorney Karl Peter Hayes in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant speaks to bond modification, hours modified and GPS issue. Court speaks to bond modification request regarding GPS monitor being taken off. Court denies request for GPS monitor to be taken off. Court authorizes bond modification of: Home by 9:30 pm unless working at Taco Bell in Minocqua - and must be home within 30 minutes after a shift. Curfew from 9:30 pm to 4:00 am with the only exception being for work purposes, Not to possess, use, or ingest illegal drugs, Maintain absolute sobriety, Not to possess or consume intoxicants, No taverns or to be in the tavern portion of any restaurant premises, notify COC in writing if address changes, continue ALS drug patch. GPS monitoring will continue. Amended bond form.

11:30 AM Defendant Dennis E Meshigaud in court.  Attorney Dennis Brown in court for State of Wisconsin. Court speaks to the defendant. Court provides the pre-sentence investigation to Mr Meshigaud. He would like to proceed pro se still. Meshigaud states his employer is going to fax another letter with more hours. Court will modify bond without another hearing. He was advised his signature would be required. Bond continued.

10:38 AM Defendant Dennis E Meshigaud in court pro se.  ADA Dennis Brown in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls 18CF20, 18CF353, 18CM27, 21CF215, 21CF217, 21CF275, 22CF53, 22TR295. Court goes through the Waiver of Right to Counsel Form reviewed on the record. Court reads the charges. Defendant reviews the Waiver of Right to Attorney Form and signs it. 

Bond continued.
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 10, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Status hearing on June 7, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant appears in court in custody without counsel. ADA Brown appears in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant waives right to counsel. Court finds the Defendant waiving right to counsel for this matter voluntarily and knowingly. Witness sworn and testified. Court takes judicial notice of 21CF275 Vilas County Case. Court makes finding of probable cause. Information filed and mirrors criminal complaint. Defendant enters not guilty pleas. Court accepts pleas. Parties speak on bond modification. Court denies motion to modify bond. Court asks parties to schedule with judicial assistant for further sentencing.

Defendant appears by video in the Vilas County Jail without counsel. DA Hayes appears in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court makes findings of probable cause. Court sets $500.00 cash bond. No specific conditions. Court sets initial appearance April 11th at 3:30pm.
